Hey, tanks a lot!

Fri Mar 7, 2008 3:52pm EST  Email | Print | Share| Reprints | Single Page| Recommend (10) [-] Text [+]  
powered by  Sphere
MOSCOW (Reuters) - A Russian tank crashed through a villager's house after the crew stopped to buy more vodka at a nearby shop.

Footage from a mobile phone camera showed the tank hitting a corner of the house and a laughing, and apparently drunk, driver awkwardly trying to clamber aboard with two bottles of vodka.

"Get him out of the tank," screamed a woman in the village in the Urals.

The army promised Friday to pay compensation and said the tank must have been broken and fallen behind a column heading to a test site for exercises. Earlier it said the vehicle slid on melting ice.

"Of course, there were violations but the crew acted in good faith to catch up with its unit," said Colonel Konstantin Lazutkin, spokesman for Russia's Volga-Urals Military District.

"Thank God, they didn't shoot," the house owner said on the video.

(Reporting by Dmitry Solovyov; Editing by Stephen Weeks)

Dragon*Con pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/12444361@N05/sets/72157603346912472/ Fall foliage: http://www.flickr.com/photos/12444361@N05/sets/72157603346887994/ I'm nearly caught up on all my email and crap. Life has improved despite me being cut off from all you wonderful shiny people. A couple of thoughts: 1) EEEEEE!!! Chuck!!! I absolutely *adore* this show. Even the non-Adamy parts. Maybe even (gasp) especially the non-Adamy parts. WD was every bit as painful as Buy-More, and then some. (Pineapple!) 2) Is it Labor Day weekend 2008 yet? Maybe 'cause it's the last time I got to talk with Browncoats for a long time, but I'm still not done rehashing this year's D*C in my head. Or maybe it's 'cause I'm one of those people for whom half the fun of something is in the planning. 3) I'm supposed to direct the Christmas program at church this year. ME?!?!?!? It might be doable if I had been the one to put it together, but Mom organized it. And I can't read her mind, and she keeps telling me how to do it, and it doesn't make sense to me, and... asack. 4) There's a huge parcel of timberland by my house that has been rezoned and divided, so now we have a bunch of new neighbors. We met one woman (and her dog) and she seems nice, but I'm not sure which of the others bothers me more--the people who hauled in a little camper for a hunting camp and haven't bothered to clean the grounds, or the people who cleared out a huge driveway and put up a fancy gate and appear to be planning a very large house with a very large yard. (Another drought like this year's, and water usage becoames a huge issue.)

I'm alive!

In case you wondered.

Will try to catch up soon.

Missed y'all.

I've been internet-less for the past month, and I'm not sure when we'll get it again.  Hopefully by the end of September.  Meanwhile, for the weekend I'm in Atlanta using Tygie's laptop, so I'm here for a bit.  I'll try to get caught up on my flist sometime, but I can't promise to--there's alcohol here, y'know. ;)

Hugs and smooches to you all!


p.s.  If you were wondering, the alarm clocks in the Marriott are HIGHLY effective.

Yeah, I'm just learning to play with it. Need to know what I'm doing by D*C. In other news, my sunmmer's been going fairly well. Not great; being unemployed sucks, and I need to make more productive use of my time, but I saved a good bit before I quit (mainly because I never had time off to spend it), so I'm in okay financial straits. I thought I'd take the free time and try to lose weight, but first it was was killer hot (90s in apr. and early may, 100s from may into june), then it started raining every afternoon. So of course I gained a lot. I feel horrible, and I'm trying to exercise more. Mom had a class to take in Tallahassee last month, and I got to go with her. Didn't get to meet up with Cavie, unfortunately, but we got to visit lots of parks and stuff on the way back. It was nice. I've been to the beach a couple of times, got a few sunburns. Was in charge of snacks at VBS this year. Fixed A LOT of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. i think that's about it.

still alive, in case anyone wondered 

not talky, though

Life has been pretty bland lately.  Boring, actually.  We had some rain a few days ago-- the first since March.  

I've been trying to get more exercise, but I can't drag myself out of bed early enough in the morning to go outside while it's still relatively cool.

In short, I'm pretty dissatisfied with myself right now.  Which means I'm cranky and avoidant right now.  Maybe I should go find a good argument to get involved in. :P

I was healthy, once upon a time.  You know, way back in the dark ages. 

At any rate, I'm functioning.  Had a pretty good day Saturday, went to the beach.  I'm afraid I'm going to have to stop that because my skin is starting to show signs of sun damage, and I don't want to end up with a leathery face before I'm fifty, if I can help it.

I seriously need exercise, but I'm always aching all over.

I think it's time for a change.  What kind, I don't know, but it's obvious that I'm dissatisfied with the way things are right now.  There's only so much I can do to change my situation, so maybe I should work on changing myself.

Thanks, y'all. :)  I get so tired of being home all the time I feel like I'm going crazy.  And it turned out I wasn't even qualified for that job I had been told I was qualified for, so that kinda hurt.

Feeling better today.

It's been a warm day, overcast/hazy/smokey.  I had thought about going to the river but it's too blah for that.  May still go for a walk to take advantage or the less-than-95 weather, though.

We managed to find homes for two kittens, but a cat I never knew was ever pregnant just brought her four up to the house.  *headdesk*  At least they're pretty.  One of them had the gray points like a siamese, but also has orange spots all over.  Never seen one like that before.

Tired.  

Depressed.  

Lonely.

I miss my friends.

It's been a very productive week. :)

Monday I filled out my application, went to the beach, and then went shopping.  Managed not to get too sunburned, but didn't find anything I wanted to buy.

Tuesday I picked the squash and made a blackberry cobbler.

Wednesday was not as good because I was horribly sick.  Sore throat, aching all over.  And today I woke up with chest congestion. Seriously, I was rattling and wheezing, but I knew it was just sinus drainage, so I spent nearly three hours doing nothing but watching DVDs and breathing deeply.  But at least I'm not hurting all over anymore.  Lungs still feel kinda funny, but I'm staying inside away from pollen.

I need new icons.  I lost them all when my old hard drive crashed, and most of those I had saved on photobucket look awful with this higher resolution.  Maybe I'll work on that later.

Good news!  I finally had my car looked at. (It's only been acting up for what, a year and a half now?)  We know what the problem is.  The bad news?  The parts are only available at the dealership, which means it's going to be expensive.  But still, likely cheaper than buying a new car.  And a whole lot easier.

Job coming open tomorrow.  I have a good shot at this one.  *fingers crossed*  I'm also hoping to do the shopping thing tomorrow.  And the beach.  Forecast is absolutely gorgeous!  And sunshine is good for my mood.

Also, please send prayers and mojo to everyone in Waycross.  One of the men in my church is a forestry firefighter and has been there since shortly after it started.  His three kids are missing their daddy something fierce.  And we just found out that some of the neighbors have family there that lost their homes.  Fortunately, it's just property so far; here's hoping it stays that way.

We've finally tracked down all of this year's kittens.  I wish I had a working camera.  Along with the usual black/black & white, we've got two calico(e?)s and two siamese.  So cute!

If you read this, if your eyes are passing over this right now, (even ifwe don't speak often) please post a comment with a COMPLETELY MADE UPAND FICTIONAL memory of you and me.

It can be anything you want - good or bad - BUT IT HAS TO BE FAKE.

Whenyou're finished, post this little paragraph on your blog and besurprised (or mortified) about what people DON'T ACTUALLY remember about you.

you are mediumauqamarine
#66CDAA

Your dominant hues are cyan and green. Although you definately strive to be logical you care about people and know there's a time and place for thinking emotionally. Your head rules most things but your heart rules others, and getting them to meet in the middle takes a lot of your energy some days.

Your saturation level is medium - You're not the most decisive go-getter, but you can get a job done when it's required of you. You probably don't think the world can change for you and don't want to spend too much effort trying to force it.

Your outlook on life is brighter than most people's. You like the idea of influencing things for the better and find hope in situations where others might give up. You're not exactly a bouncy sunshine but things in your world generally look up.
the spacefem.com html color quiz
Hmmm, seems like I took this before and got a lime-y green. *** The good stuff happening in my life, since I haven't focused on it much lately: 1) Summertime! Well, the weather is not yet fully cooperating, but all the other signs are there. The persimmon trees have budded out, and they are the last to do so. They usually don't until May. The pecan trees are blooming, and that isn't supposed to happen until June! There's a whippoorwill just down the hill singing every night, and nighthawks and bats chasing bugs in the evenings. The dewberries are getting ripe! I had a whole handful today. 2) Tuesday night Mom and I went to watch one of the girls from church play ball in the 6-8 year-old league. So cute! It was machine-pitch, but she was the pitcher for fielding purposes. The girls played their hearts out, and I didn't hear any nasty youth-league parents there. It was hard not to root for both teams. The littlest girl on either team hit a home run, and boy, if I could have sold her for what she felt like she was worth! :D 3) We had a pair of tiny kittens show up on the breezeway, and no idea which cat they belonged to. Fortunately, they've been adopted--by a cat who for years I thought was sterile, then gave birth to a litter too deformed to live. She's incredibly stupid in many ways, but is a good, caring, protective momma cat. Aw. :)

Travel Horoscope for Leo
When you travel, you crave sun soaked days and warm nights. You want a vacation where you can party hard and sleep in the sun all day. You should travel to: Cancun Miami Bali Saint Tropez Key West
What's Your Travel Horoscope?

Thanks for all the well wishes!

Unfortunately, it turns out the call was for my mom, and their database doesn't show she's already working for the county.

I don't know whether to laugh or cry.  Mostly cry, because the week has been so horrible.  

I hate funerals.  Even worse when it's for someone fairly young.  Worse still when it's suicide.

It's been a rough week so far and it's only going to get worse.

On the up side, I got a call for a job interview and am trying to get that set up.

Wish me luck!


<small>p.s. and I'm almost caught up on everything.  yay!</small>

YYYYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!11111

Hard drive crashed last week and I haven't had a computer since.

We got a new one today.  Wheee!

But I lost all my links and photos and stuff. :(

I think I can find everything again, but it will take months.

Also, I'm waaay behind on email and lj and the OB.

But I'm back!

Uuuugggggghhhhhhhh...............

The first part of the week was great.  Felt wonderful.  Went down to Destin to do some shopping.  (Water won't be warm enough for swimming for another month.)  Had a blast.

Then Thursday I got sick again.  Worse.  High fever, dizzy.  Not gonna bother going to the doctor because I know it's just a sinus infection and it'll pass in a few days.

Still, it's not fair!

Sick.  
Feel.  So.  Bad.  
Ache all over.  Head hurts.  Running a fever.
Slept until noon.  Read until about two.  Got up and washed dishes.  Got back in bed. 
Put shoes on at four, took dog for walk.  Got chased by neighbor dogs again.  Took shortcut through aunt's yard and had to crawl under fence in wet leaves.
Came home, cleaned up, took nap.
Woke up at five.  Took temperature.  Took tylenol.  Ate supper.  Church.
Came home. Logged on.  Time to log off. Will wash dishes, take tylenol, and go back to bed.

uuuuuugggggghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

I felt wonderful this morning.  I felt smart and talented and confident.

So how did I go to feeling like a complete loser who'd never find a decent job in just a couple of hours?

It's not fair!

I know what it is.  I was hoping to have a new job fairly quicky, and it's taking WAAAAY longer than I thought.  I quit on Wed. 12/27, and Mom was going to get me a job application on Thursday, I'd have the whole holiday weekend to fill it out, and call Tuesday to turn it in.  Except she was sick, and didn't go back to work until Tuesday, and the head of HR wasn't there to give her the application until Wednesday, and then I realized I had to have my college transcripts, which I just got late this afternoon...

Waaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!

I know it's only been two weeks, but I'm terrified.  I can't stand staying at home all day, and with as many bills as I have to pay, I can't afford to go anywhere, either.

Grrr...

*** Dragon*con. Yeah, wasn't that fun? Real update later this week. I so needed that vacation, 'cause RL just got pretty sucky. Not ony did work go nuts while I was gone, but B. is probably going to leave, too. More on that later, as well. I promise to focus on the upside, though.

My birthday was Friday, and it was pretty good! I had posted a list on our little messageboard at work: I want: - a million dollars - a new car, preferably a convertible - my own private island - a pony What they gave me was: - a little Hot Wheels convertible - a puzzle that was a picture of an island - a My Little Pony - ten dollars (They couldn't find any play money.) Hee! So cute. My parents gave me a new tv (mine had gotten hit by lightning). I did get my vacation approved, so I'm all set for Dragon*Con! I'll probably start packing on my next day off. ;)

Wheeee!

We shut the store down at ten instead of midnight, this time with approval from the big boss, and those of us who were still there went up on the roof to celebrate with fireworks and booze.  I had the good sense to avoid the alcohol until about 11:30... only had a third of a bottle of Smirnoff and evreyhting's all bendy.  It was fun, though, at least as much funa s you can really have hanging with upper management, y'know?  The entrance to teh roof is through teh machine room and up a ladder to the hatch on the roof--feels like somtehing out of the movies.  I caught myself humming the James Bond theme a couple of times.

And yes, I know this post is riddles with spelling errors, but you know what?  I don't care!  Whheeeeeeee!

Oh, and the cops had some kind of a bust at teh BP across the street, had three patro;l cars over there.  And then they came over and ran off the teenagers that were loitering in our parking lot.

So ILJ = tipsy.  And debating whether to finish that bottle or leave it for tomoorrw.

In other news, people suck, customers are stupid, management bites (except for you-know-who), and the folks way on up the corporate ladder are a bunch of brain-dead backbirths wouldn't know their ass from a hole in the ground. Only 72 days until Dragon*Con!!!!!!

In the last week at work I've had: -a guy come through not once but twice in one night trying to use stolen checks -a guy who's been trying to pick up thousands of dollars wired to him or his family members every day (and sometimes twice a day) -a marriage proposal from my manager (kidding [I think]) -two girls fighting over me (again, kidding [I think]) -a meth bust in the parking lot -an "American Idol" competition over the PA system -a fight in the makeup aisle And that's only been three days of work. Today was apparently Stupid People on the Phone Day, and I had people calling looking for phone numbers to other stores, wanting to know if they could get helium tanks refilled, and, oh yeah, a prank call from the aforementioned manager. Kinda looking forward to tomorrow just to see what wackiness will ensue. :)

We passed inspection yesterday!!!  That means, as far as we know, the store stays open and I get to keep my job. :) :) :)

It was very slow last night, so we celebrated by having a tournament on the basketball game in the lobby.  As a result, my arms are pretty tired today.  But it was fun!

I got my raise today, I got my raise today!!!!!!

*happydance*

Spiteful Loner
You are 57% Rational, 0% Extroverted, 85% Brutal, and 28% Arrogant.
You are the Spiteful Loner, the personality type that is most likely to go on a shooting rampage. You are a rational person and tend to hold emotions in very low-esteem; not only that, but you are also rather introverted, meaning you probably bury any emotions you feel deep inside yourself. Combine these traits with your hatred of others and your brutality, and it seems that you would be quite likely to shoot innocent people in a rampage. Not only that, but you are also a very humble person--not a braggart at all--meaning you could possibly have low-self esteem. This is only yet one more incentive to go on a shooting rampage, because you wouldn't care if you died as a result. Granted, you probably haven't gone on a shooting rampage and probably never will, but all the motivations are there. In conclusion, your personality is defective because you are too introverted, brutal, insecure, and rather unemotional. No wonder no one hangs around you, you morbid, cold-hearted freak!

To put it less negatively:

1. You are more RATIONAL than intuitive.

2. You are more INTROVERTED than extroverted.

3. You are more BRUTAL than gentle.

4. You are more HUMBLE than arrogant.

Compatibility:

Your exact opposite is the Televangelist.

Other personalities you would probably get along with are the Capitalist Pig, the Smartass, and the Sociopath.

*

*

You Have a Melancholic Temperament
Introspective and reflective, you think about everything and anything. You are a soft-hearted daydreamer. You long for your ideal life. You love silence and solitude. Everyday life is usually too chaotic for you. Given enough time alone, it's easy for you to find inner peace. You tend to be spiritual, having found your own meaning of life. Wise and patient, you can help people through difficult times. At your worst, you brood and sulk. Your negative thoughts can trap you. You are reserved and withdrawn. This makes it hard to connect to others. You tend to over think small things, making decisions difficult.

DEAR ASSHOLE CUSTOMERS:

Thank you SO much for ruining my night.  It wasn't enough for me to have to deal with a whiny cashier going home early and being by myself in the office; no, you all had to come in and make it worse. Thank you EVER so much.

To the lady who wrote a bad check *KNOWING* it was going to show up in the system and I couldn't accepting: I hope to God you enjoyed your damn magazine after you put back the other ten items you couldn't pay for with cash.

To the people standing in line wating while she did all this:  I'm sorry you had to wait.  Or I was, until I put my ALREADY COUNTED AND RECONCILED till back down there to help you out, and you decided to chew me out. Over having to wait while I opened my rolls of change, Over paying more than you thought you should because you didn't read the gorramn sign right there in front of the milk--I should have made you come back in the morning when the service desk was open, but since you told me to put it back FIVE FRICKING TIMES, I wasn't in the mood to argue with you.

To the lady who was upset over a five dollar roast and nine dollar crab legs: have you not shopped since the stone age?  Those were good prices-- and they were printed right there on the products, so you should have seen them BEFORE you had me scan them.  Dumbass.

To the lady who got a whole buggy piled full and came up to the register at five minutes til closing: I hate you.  Shop at a reasonable hour.

Same to the guy who didn't make it to the register until five after. I already told you we didn't have the ice cream you wanted.  Sorry.  Standing there staring into the freezer isn't going to make it appear, I promise.

To the safe, which kept coming up short:  Sure, you're an inanimate object, or so you say, but that doesn't mean I can't be mad at you.  You're lucky I don't try to push you out the window, buddy.

To management:  You have NO idea how lucky you are I waited to dump all this on LJ instead of on the idiots themselves.

Baker, my hometown.  Where I graduated from high school.

I live about ten miles out of town, so I'm safe.  The kids from my church were in the school, though.  The wing of the building they would have been in was destroyed.

I haven't updated in a while, so... 1) It's pretty darn sweet to see that "Asst FE Mgr" under my name instead of "Cashier". I'm in the office three days a week and J is in there the other four. Fortunatley, we get along great and often help each other out however we can. 2) My check for my D*C membership is in the mail!!! :D I wish I could afford to do all the big cons and shindigs this year. I really wish I could go to Orlando later this moth, but it ain't gonna happen. I miss my Florida 'coats! 3) There is no three, but a list with only two items looks really pathetic. ;) Happy Tuesday, everyone!

Guess who may be getting that promotion after all? :)

Sort of.  I'll probably be in the office two or three days a week and on a register the rest of the time, but still, it'll help.  It'll mean a move to the night shift, which means I get to go back to sleeping late. Which I think is even better than the pay.  Or maybe not.

Today was a whole lot quieter than I figured it would be.  We managed to get the whole place shut down and get out by five after closing time.  Niiice!

Every day this week, people have brought piles of food for lunch for everyody.  I've gained ten pounds since Thanksgiving.  ugh.  Gonna have to do that New Year's diet thing, I guess.  Assuming they stop with the food.

You Passed 8th Grade Science
Congratulations, you got 8/8 correct!
Could You Pass 8th Grade Science?

The last two days have been almost as busy as the weekend before Thanksgiving. I like being productive (twice as much in sales as normal!) but good grief. What gives? It's not the first of the month, it's too early for Christmas groceries, and the kids aren't out of school until next week, so it isn't that either. Huh. I feel kinda like I've been run over by a truck. Good thing I'm off tomorrow!

Sleepy.  Something keeps waking me up too early in the morning, and although I'm getting my full eight hours of sleep, it's broken into a five hour stretch and a three hour one.  Not tired though.

At work last Friday I had a woman come through my line and got PO'ed at me when I wouldn't cash a check for her without ID.  Smart move; the bank called today to report that check stolen.  Yay, me.  On the other hand, I had a minor temper tantrum when my boss pulled me off a perfectly good register and made me test the crappy one to see if it had worked, thus irritating me AND my customers.  They could have tested it while it was in training mode.  Dumbasses.  Then they put the other cashier over there for a bit, and made her suffer with it.  As far as I know, it was still broken when they repair guy left.  Fucking idiots.  GRRRR...  And it turns out I'm highly allergic to the dust and mold and crap that's stirred up by the heating system, too, so I had the red-faced, sneezing, watery-eye thing going on today.  Mucho fun.

Everything is good in other news, though.  I've been feeling highly creative lately and have tons of energy.  Which of course goes to waste when my eyes won't stay open, but I do seem to be getting more done in my off-time.  More exercise, more writing, more painting.

Friday is Browncoat Day-- the anniversary of the Variety ad in '02, and the FF DVD release in '03.  I plan to turn it into Take Your Action Figure To Work Day. ;)  I keep thinking surely I can make a few converts there eventually.
